column4: if the kernel image and initrd are in the /boot directory, why would i have a kernel panic?
the images are supposed to be in /boot?
well, a kernel panic means your kernel is found, it runs, but then it crashes
are you using intrepid?  if so, try installing linux-backports-modules
if you have the -generic kernel installed, then you should get the -generic version of lbm, I think
so what if i'm compling a kernel with the wireless extensions?
sorry, I've no idea.   That means you aren't using the ubuntu kernel, right?   Anyway, here is the bug report for the ubuntu kernel: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/259157
well, you might as well give lbm a shot.  It won't mess up your attempt to compile your own kernel, and it might get your ath5k working.  Worth a shot?
the package I was telling you about earlier, Linux-Backports-Modules
but once i make the kerenel and do a make install, do i have to run a mkinitramfs comand or something?
I dunno.  I've never compiled a kernel before
hmm, done it a few times on linux, several times on the BSD's, a bit different.
